result.execSummary:
The defendant Victoria Lynn Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Payment of costs & fees and all court obligations, restitution and supervision fees.

Obtain GED - preferrably while in jail.
Obtain and maintain stable employment.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

Absolute sobriety.
No alcohol, drugs, illegal drugs or marijuana (including no use of medical marijuana).
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with J.H. in any form.
No contact with anyone on supervision (except as necessary through whatever counseling is determined).
No contact with known drug users, dealers or drug houses.

Maximum supervision based on DOC evaluation.
Successful completionof AODA testing and treatment and follow through.
Assessments and follow through as required by agent.

timeConds.notes:
No good time.
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
Each year of probation; as worked out with agent to work with young girls telling them of her experiiences.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Victoria Lynn Williams in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Defendant Victoria Lynn Williams in custody.  Kent R. Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:23 pm
ADA spks on PSI
Atty Wallace spks on PSI
ADA spks on sentencing
Atty Wallace spks on sentencing
Defendant's mother L.M. addresses Court
Defendant addresses Court
Court imposes:  Imposed & stayed 4 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision.  Defendant is not eligible for CIP or SAP.  3 years probation.  Conditions:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.
1 year jail, no good time,  huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations, credit for 225 days.
50 hours community service each year of probation - as worked out with agent to work with young girls telling them of her experiences.
Written Expl of Det Sent
